summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between law enforcement personnel regarding scheduling an interview with an individual named Mullen and coordinating the submission of a corrected search warrant affidavit for drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. It reveals ongoing investigative activity related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding a draft affidavit for a corrected search warrant for drives from Epstein's residence. Likely the lead detective on the task force.

persons.name: Mullen
persons.context: An individual whose interview was canceled and is being rescheduled by the NYPD/FBI task force during the week of October 26, 2020.

connections.description: Paul, as part of the NYPD/FBI task force, is involved in scheduling an interview with Mullen, indicating Mullen is a person of interest or witness in their investigation.

events.title: Scheduling of Mullen Interview
events.description: Law enforcement personnel coordinate via email to reschedule an interview with an individual named Mullen, which was originally planned for October 26 but canceled.

events.title: Draft Affidavit for Corrected Warrant Submitted
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends a draft affidavit and exhibits to Detective Paul in support of an amended search warrant for three drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence.

keyFacts: Investigators were actively working on a corrected/amended search warrant application for digital drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence as of October 2020.
An interview with an individual named Mullen was a scheduled investigative activity being coordinated between the NYPD and FBI.
The correspondence shows ongoing post-Epstein's-death investigative work by the Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The document references a prior seizure of evidence (three drives) from Epstein's New York home.
